Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: cp

Arguments.Name: a
Arguments.Description: Preserves structure and attributes of files but not directory structure

Arguments.Name: f
Arguments.Description: If the destination file cannot be opened, remove it and create a new file, without prompting for confirmation

Arguments.Name: H
Arguments.Description: If the -R option is specified, symbolic links on the command line are followed

Arguments.Name: i
Arguments.Description: Cause cp to write a prompt to the standard error output before copying a file that would overwrite an existing file

Arguments.Name: L
Arguments.Description: If the -R option is specified, all symbolic links are followed

Arguments.Name: n
Arguments.Description: Do not overwrite an existing file

Arguments.Name: P
Arguments.Description: If the -R option is specified, no symbolic links are followed

Arguments.Name: R
Arguments.Description: If source designates a directory, cp copies the directory and the entire subtree connected at that point. If source ends in a /, the contents of the directory are copied rather than the directory itself

Arguments.Name: v
Arguments.Description: Cause cp to be verbose, showing files as they are copied

Arguments.Name: X
Arguments.Description: Do not copy Extended Attributes (EAs) or resource forks
